From the channel lineup, Launch an application channel then press *RC-OK Key*

Ensure that application can be launched automatically or with a press on a *"start button"*
Zap to a live DVB-C channel
Expected Result:
The behavior is exactly the same as a normal channel: a video stream or an image will be displayed.

The application is launched. : Selected channel is well displayed (i.e: audio video OK and displayed info)
Live is OK (audio , video and displayed info)

Summary: Live_DVB-C_Scanning status after interuption
Action:
Select Channel Scan.  
Select Start Auto Scan entry.  
Press RC_OK.


Wait until the scan progress reaches > 5% and interrupt it by pressing the EXIT button if available
In the 50% of scanning, plug out/in the power cable
In the 50% of scanning, unplug/plug signal cable
Expected Result:
Scanning must be started




The channel scan is interrupted, the previously saved channel lineup is *NOT* discarded and the channel playback works as expected
DUT reboots

Found channel are lost

DUT returns to the last channel list ( before scanning)
Found channel are lost

DUT returns to the last channel list ( before scanning)

*For Vodafone products:*

when unplug signal cable at 50%: scan is completed and all channels are displayed correctly

Summary: Live_DVB-C_Check Channel Scan
Action:
1- Select Channel Scan. 
2-Select Start Auto Scan entry. 
3- Press RC_OK

4-Check channel list according to the customer specs or comparing to the
refernce versions
Browse the list of channel

Play some channels
For a given DVB-C channel and if applicable

Go to system information and check the following info:
 * TV quality
 * Channel name
 * Signal strength
 * ABR
Expected Result:
1- Scan Starts

2-Scan is performed

3- All DVB-C channels are scanned and available

4- LCN should be as the LCN asked by customer

 

 

P.S: LCN is the acronym of *Logical Channel Number*
A/V synchronization is OK. No macroblocks/glitch audio

Navigation and zapping are smooth
Information are displayed correctly and as expected
 * Channel name
 * Signal strength value should be between -41dBm…-61dBm
 * BER value should be = 0
 * SNR value should be < 50 dB
